paragraphs.content: Chapter 32
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 32

paragraphs.content: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

paragraphs.content: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

paragraphs.content: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

paragraphs.content: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.

paragraphs.content: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

paragraphs.content: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.

paragraphs.content: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

paragraphs.content: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

paragraphs.content: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

paragraphs.content: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

paragraphs.content: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

paragraphs.content: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:

paragraphs.content: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

paragraphs.content: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.

paragraphs.content: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.

paragraphs.content: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)

paragraphs.content: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

paragraphs.content: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

paragraphs.content: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.

paragraphs.content: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.

paragraphs.content: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

paragraphs.content: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
